returns._0: the amount of PRV that the user can still withdraw for a given window
the amount of PRV that can still be withdrawn in the window
whether the user can still withdraw for a given window
the window at a given index, encoded as a struct

params._prv: the address of the PRV contract - must implement IPRV as Auxo address will be fetched from it

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setPRV(address).details: Auxo address will be fetched from the PRV contract and updated

setWindow(uint256,bytes32,uint32,uint32).details: the previous window is deleted - this will disable claims until the new window begins.there must be sufficient AUXO in the PRV contract to cover this amount or the tx will revert

params._endBlock: the block number at which the window ends. Must be greater than _startBlock
params._maxAmount: the maximum amount of PRV that can be redeemed in the window
params._merkleRoot: the merkle root of the claims in the window
params._startBlock: the block number at which the window starts

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

verify(uint256,address,bytes).details: we allow repeated claims so long as the total amount claimed is less than the amount in the merkle tree.

params._account: the address of the user who is redeeming the PRV
params._amount: the amount of PRV to redeem, can be less than the claim amount if the user is only redeeming part of the claim

returns._0: true if the claim is valid, false otherwise

params._claim: claim object describing rewards, accountIndex, account, window index, and merkle proof.

returns._0: whether the passed window index is currently accepting withdrawals
the amount of PRV that has been withdrawn by the user for a given window

PRV().notice: the address of the PRV contract

deleteWindow(uint256).notice: Delete window at the specified index if it exists.

nextWindowIndex().notice: Index of most next window to be created

pause().notice: see openzeppelin docs for more info on pausable

setPRV(address).notice: whitelists the process withdrawal function to just the PRV contract

setWindow(uint256,bytes32,uint32,uint32).notice: instantiates a new window with a given merkle root and max amount, bounded by start and end blocks.

verify(uint256,address,bytes).notice: takes a request to redeem some amount of PRV and verifies that it is both valid and within the budget.

verifyClaim((uint256,uint256,bytes32[],a.notice: Returns True if leaf described by {account, windowIndex, amount} is stored in Merkle root at given window index.

@dev internal method that avoids ownable modifier.
      setWindow ensures that we can rely on an endBlock of zero to only be present if the window has no data
